fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64539].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Disabling the jira-importers-plugin causes the Software and Service Desk applications to disable. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to manage add-ons >> all add-ons
# Disable jira-importers-plugin

h3. Expected Results
The JIM plugin should be a system plugin and therefore not subject to being disabled.
h3. Actual Results
The JIRA Applications become disabled, and JIM is disabled as wel
 
h3.Workaround
Re-enable the JIM plugin, then re-enable the other plugins, or restart.
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin needs to be system plugin
Create new links types on the fly during import
JSON (and others?) importer should accept compressed input
Make JIM compatible with Mantis on Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64535].
  {panel}

When a column name is repeated in imported CSV we allow mapping only to standard fields that can handle multiple values.
However, we allow selecting any (incompatible) custom field types.

We should limit the list of existing custom fields and possible types for new custom fields only to compatible ones.
Otherwise we get data loss, see JIM-457
fields.summary: When importing from CSV with repeated column names allow selecting only suitable custom fields

in bugzilla you can have prodcuts with group rights.
i think the same applies for JIRA.

unfortunately currently the bugzilla importer does not obey the group rights.
As simple feature would be that

    * the correpsonding group gets created
    * all users belonging to the group get assigned to the group
    * the product gets assigned to the group

h3. Problem Definition
Current version of [Asana Importer Plugin for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-asana-plugin/server/versionhistory] doesn't support DataCenter. 

Version 1.0.5
JIRA Server 6.2 - 7.1.9
Released 2016-03-17

h3. Suggested Solution
 Enable support for JIRA DataCenter
fields.summary: Support JIRA datacenter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64520].
  {panel}

At the moment, it is possible for users to import a project when importing data from CSV file:
!scshot.png!

And when importing the project, it is possible for us to import project Components as well. However, apparently the CSV importer is missing the feature to allow user to specify the Component Lead from the CSV file. 

It will be great if the CSV importer allows us to specify component lead when importing project with components from CSV file. 

Sample CSV to import project, components and issues is attached to this request.
fields.summary: Add the ability to specify the Component Lead for components created via CSV file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64516].
  {panel}

JSON Exporter is not including issue links in the exported data.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create Issue A and Issue B
2. Create a link (any kind) between Issue A and Issue B
3. Go to issue A
4. Make JSON Export

Expected (Option 1.): Exported data contains Issue A and Issue B and link A->B
Expected (Option 2.): Exported data contains Issue A and link A->B

Actual: Exported data contains Issue A and no links.
fields.summary: JSON Export does not include Issue Links
Set Global Context for custom fields created

Steps to reproduce:
 1. Delete any "Story Point" from custom fields
 2. Create new custom field - Story point / Number field
 3. Create Agile sample demo project

Observed:

* OS
* OS Version

These fields should be always imported as Custom Fields or allow user to pick destination field.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64507].

h3. Problem Definition
Customers are trying to migrate from Assembla to JIRA.  At this time, there is not a native option to directly import from this other system and the CSV Import process requires significant modification to the data in order to make it compatible for importing. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a native import option from Assembla

h3. Workaround 
CSV Import
fields.summary: Native JIRA Import from Assembla

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64506].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to import JIRA Service Desk SLA using CSV importer hence it would be great if there is a feature to do so.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to import JSD SLA custom field through CSV importer.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to import JSD SLA custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64503].
  {panel}

The OnBoarding process often takes longer than just moving from tracker A to tracker B in the precise point in time. The reason for that is people are often not sure if they even want to migrate in the first place. For that reason JIRA is offered as a try-and-buy product. And for the very same reason the issue importing process should also be spread in time.

As a user I would like to be able to continue using my old tracker and use JIRA at the same time before I decide to move to JIRA completely. During that time I expect:
* to modify the data in my legacy tracker and see these changes automatically progressing to JIRA
* to be able to modify the data in JIRA as well, but *I do not expect* the synchronisation to be also performed into my old tracker

so that I could get the better understanding of JIRA and gradually move over there when I am ready.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to set up JIM to periodically update my issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64502].
  {panel}

Users who are importing issues from an external system may not want to have an Agile board created automatically or users may want to choose which type of Agile board is created.


*Current behavior:*
Importer automatically creates a 'best suited for' Agile board automatically for the user

*Expected behavior*
Import wizard should offer a selection of Create: Scrum, Agile, Do not create an Agile board



*Workaround:*
Currently a customer can import external issues, create a new Agile board based on the new project, and then delete the Agile board they do not want to use.
fields.summary: Allow for the selection of Agile board

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64500].

JIM does not allow to link two issues from different projects if they are not added in the single import.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to JSON Importer
2. Import corssProject.json
3. Wait until import is finished successfully
4. Go to JSON Importer
5. Import crossProject2.json
6. Import should finish correctly (right now it's raising bug that some External Issue IDs cannot be found)
fields.summary: Allow to link issues from two different imports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64492].
{panel}
Lets say a user wants to import the QA_Contacts field from a Bugzilla instance. As this field cannot yet be imported as per this feature request: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-533]

So the logical thing to do is to import the field separately via CSV import. The problem here is that the *Updated* field of the issue will be overwritten with the latest date. This is a big problem for customers who wants to preserve historical data on older, closed tickets.

Even if you manually specify the Updated field to a column in the CSV file, the CSV importer does not import those values and the Date Updated field will be set to the latest date, and not to the value you specified in the CSV import.

This happens because Jira considers the CSV import on top of an existing issue as an update to the issue itself and thus, puts current datetime in the updated date field. 

The updated date field will reflect the value from the CSV if the issue is not present prior to the import.
fields.summary: CSV Import does not import the "Date Updated" field for existing issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64488].
  {panel}

The importWorklog method of DefaultJiraDataImporter makes a call to
 
worklogManager.create(userProvider.getUser(externalWorklog.getAuthor()), worklog, null, false);

The method adds worklog to issue worklog and also adds an item to the history table. The worklog item is ok:

guena logged work - 01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent:2 hours 
Validate

However, the corresponding history item is not ok:

guena made changes - 8 hours ago 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]  

It should be like

guena made changes  01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]
fields.summary: worklogManager uses current date\time instead of supplied one for history

Actual Behavior:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64480].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Issues in Pivotal don't have a *Priority* set, and thus are imported in to JIRA with no Priority set. This results in the *Priority* being hidden when using defaults and viewing a just-imported Issue.

However, when Editing an existing Issue or Creating a new one in this Project, because Priority is typically part of the *Scheme* for the project, it is not possible _not_ to set the Priority.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add some sort of check such that imports to an empty Project don't have *Priority* in the related Screens.
h3. Workaround

Define a new "None" priority, and then manually bulk-update imported Issues to set Priorities.
fields.summary: When importing from Pivotal to an empty Project, remove Priority from relevant Screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64472].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like to import Trac data into their Atlassian Cloud instance however the Trac DB is PostgreSQL.
Per the [JIM Importing Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/importing-issues-692420684.html#ImportingIssues-ImportingissuesfromCSVfiles,FogBugzOnDemand,PivotalTrackerandTrac] documentation, only SQLite Databases are supported when importing from Trac.

h3. Suggested Solution
Expand Database compatibility for Trac import into the Atlassian Cloud
 
h3. Workaround 
It is not noted JIRA Server Instances have this limitation:
- Setup a Staging JIRA Server and Import the Trac Data to it
- Perform a [JIRA Server to Cloud Migration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Migrating+from+JIRA+Server+to+JIRA+Cloud]
fields.summary: Support for Importing from Trac Using Databases Other than SQLite to the Atlassian Cloud
Migrate default values for Mantis issues (not stored in DB)
Allow mapping of users during Bitbucket issues import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64468].
  {panel}

If JSON import contains issues with a status that is invalid for the selected workflow they are not going to be imported, by the rest of the import will be performed.

When importing lots of data this is a huge productivity killer because you end-up with a project that has one some issues imported and also that has lots of issuelinks broken due to this. 

Always you have to remove all the imported issues and start over again. Removing all these issues (like 20.000) is very hard, and not even possible using the Bulk edit.

This is a request to prevent the import in case of errors like this, allowing the user to  fix / regenerate the JSON file, or to repair the workflow configuration and to attempt the import again.
fields.summary: Prevent entire import if any status is invalid
Unify attachment handling in JIM API

We should offer users some solution for this.

Raised from https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+FogBugz+for+Your+Server?focusedCommentId=419005067#comment-419005067

Cc [~clepetit]
fields.summary: Support rich text format in FogBugz

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64455].
  {panel}

When user try to import a project from pivotal tracker, they will see this warning message:
{code}
Commenter named Spiderman not found. Creating issue with currently logged in user instead
{code}

*Steps to reproduced it*
# Go to External System Import > choose Import from Pivotal Tracker.
# Key in username and password and expand *Advanced*
# Check *Map user names* and *Use an existing configuration file* option ([^test.txt]).
# Click Next and choose the desired project and proceed.
# Get this warning message:
!pivotal-tracker.png|thumbnail!

*Cause*
One of the member in the Pivotal Tracker project is being removed.

*Change Request*
As a user, it will be great if we can revise the warning message to be more meaningful or clear of what's going on.
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker warning message
Improve errors readability in the logs to include more information about the error
As a JIRA Admin I would like JIM to support a codespaces importer
Make language changes is JIM accordingly to TW review
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a ServiceNow importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64448].
  {panel}

I don't know that this is limited to CSV (and I suspect it is not) but it is the module I care most about.

When importing the file I can map the field "assigned to" >>>> "assignee", perfect.  And the same is true for "Created By" to "Reporter" But Jira assumes 3 things that are not correct!
# usernames are simply the spaceless concatenation of real names (how many of your customers use "employee IDs" that have nothing to do with name?)
# emails _always_ follow a LASTNAMEf@domain.com pattern where 'f' is the first initial of first name (what about first.last, or fLAST, or f.last ?)
# if these assumptions don't line up, it must be a new user (but in reality our jira is connected to our enterprise ldap and knows _all_ users !)

SO my suggestion pretty simple:

Please allow the import the option of *looking up users* based on imported username/real name/email, and select the field to search by.  I could then very easily tell Jira to lookup users by the "User Name Contains", "Full Name Contains:" or "Email Contains"  and pull back a valid user ID, Email, and Real name.

I would much rather this then have to write a macro to update my csv file replacing "last, first" with "employeeID".
fields.summary: Allow email and username mapping instead of naive defaults

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64447].

* {{Fixed in Version}} field is automatically mapped to Fix Version/s
* {{Target Version}} field is not mapped

Customers would also like to map *Target Version* field but find no way to do so. Is it possible to consider this a new feature for importing data from Mantis?
fields.summary: Map Target Version when importing from Mantis
